business.headline: ITR-6 excel utility now live: Who is eligible to file?The Income Tax Department has rolled out the excel utility for ITR-6 for AY 2025-26. But this form isn't meant for everyone — here's who is required to use it.

Regaal Resources IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP & listing dateInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (previously known as Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).
Maruti Suzuki rallies 8%: Why GST relief is driving auto stocks higherEarly trade clearly showed strong buying in auto and financial stocks, while IT and pharma names dragged at the bottom.

Sensex jumps 1,000 points: Why is stock market rising today?At 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 950.18 points at 81,547.84, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 310 points to 24,941.90. Broader market indices also gained as investors cheered the prospects of a simplified GST regime and an upgrade in India's sovereign credit rating by S&P.
Sensex, Nifty surge as PM hints at GST reforms by Diwali; Maruti jumps 7%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,062.91 points to 81,659.75, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 356 points to 24,987.30 as of 9:32 am.

Treated like strangers: Sunjay Kapur's sister alleges family sidelined by companyMandhira Kapur Smith alleged that the family has been treated as strangers, adding that the names of family
members were not included in obituaries and public acknowledgments.

Should you let AI analyse your online spending habits?Artificial intelligence is gradually slipping into our wallets. From tracking what we buy to predicting our next expense, AI-based tools are becoming popular. But should you really let AI analyse your online spending habits?

Trade deal talks hit roadblock as US delegation's India visit could be delayedThe India-US trade deal talks face a potential roadblock as the US delegation may delay its August 25 visit to India. This postponement impacts scheduled negotiations that were crucial for preventing additional tariffs. A 50% tariff on Indian goods is set to take effect from August 27. Currently, a 25% tariff is already in place, impacting exporters. The deferment of the meeting does not signify cancellation, but rather a delay. Reasons for the delay could be operational or related to geopolitical outcomes. "A 50% tariff will be imposed on us from August 27 in totality." The BTA deal is anticipated by the end of September or October, with expectations for a meeting by the end of August, contingent on geopolitical developments.

Trade deal in limbo as US team's India visit deferred amid tariff warThe United States has been pressing India to open its agriculture and dairy sectors, but New Delhi has ruled out concessions, saying such moves would endanger small farmers and cattle rearers.

Real wallet-friendly shake-up: GST 2.0 to feel like 'Good and Simple Tax'The government is set to launch GST 2.0 with major rate cuts, making essentials cheaper and simplifying tax slabs. The overhaul promises lower prices, fewer complications, and a true 'Good and Simple Tax'.

What nobody tells you about buying motor insuranceWhile car sales are climbing, many buyers remain unaware about the finer points of motor insurance, a gap that can cost them money and create problems when making a claim.

Government proposes 5%, 18% GST slabs; tobacco at 40%, relief for farmers: SourcesThe government has proposed reducing GST to two slabs: 5% and 18% with sin goods at 40%, aiming to cut taxes on essentials like farm products, health items, handicrafts, and insurance.

entertainment.headline: GOT7's Jackson Wang hospitalised due to illness, cancels scheduled fan meetingK-pop group GOT7 member Jackson Wang was admitted to the hospital due to food poisoning and has been advised to rest. It led to the cancellation of his planned fan signing event.

Anupam Kher shares nostalgic pics, moving note on friend Robert De Niro's birthdayAnupam Kher shared a heartfelt birthday tribute to Hollywood legend Robert De Niro, highlighting their friendship and De Niro's global influence on actors.

Leonardo DiCaprio-Vittoria Ceretti soak up the sun on yacht during Spain getawayLeonardo DiCaprio and Vittoria Ceretti enjoyed a public display of affection during a yacht trip, marking a rare public appearance of their relationship.

Singer Kanika Kapoor says singers earn just Rs 101 for songs in IndiaPopular singer Kanika Kapoor has opened up about the financial hardships faced by vocalists in the Indian music industry. She revealed that many singers receive minimal payments and rely mainly on live shows for income.

Janhvi Kapoor reacts to trolling over Bharat Mata Ki Jai chant at Dahi Handi eventActor Janhvi Kapoor responded to trolls over chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan at the Janmashtami event. She shared the original clip and apoke about becoming a meme material.

Not a historian: Bengal Files actor Saswata Chatterjee distances himself from rowActor Saswata Chatterjee, in a recent interview, stated that Vivek Agnihotri's film was initially titled 'The Delhi Files' and was later changed to 'The Bengal Files'. He also pointed out that he was not informed of this decision, nor was he aware of the full story.

Triptii Dimri's rumoured boyfriend Sam Merchant sees her off at Mumbai airportActor Triptii Dimri was seen at Mumbai airport, where her alleged boyfriend, businessman Sam Merchant, dropped her off in his blue Porsche. The two have long been speculated to be dating for a while now.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna hold hands, lead India Day Parade in New YorkVijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna were the Grand Marshals at the India Day Parade in New York. The two were seen holding hands and waving to their fans at the event.

Actor Terence Stamp, who played Superman villain General Zod, dies at 87Actor Terence Stamp, known for his role as General Zod, has died aged 87. He also played a key role in actor Tom Cruise's World War 2 period-drama 'Valkyrie' (2008).

Veteran Marathi actor Jyoti Chandekar dies at 68 after prolonged illnessVeteran Marathi actor Jyoti Chandekar, known for her role as Poorna Aji in 'Tharala Tar Mag', died in Pune at the age of 68 after a long illness. Her daughter Tejaswini Pandit and the Marathi film industry remembered her for her long and memorable career.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui opens up on his bond with daughter Shora: My biggest criticActor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said his daughter Shora keeps him grounded and often scolds him without caring about his stardom.

Janhvi-Sidharth relish Lucknow chaat ahead of Param Sundari release. VideoJanhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra enjoyed chaat in Lucknow while promoting their upcoming film 'Param Sundari'. The romantic drama, releasing on August 29, has already created buzz with its trailer and the duo's on-screen chemistry.

Men should rule: Kerala actor's sexist rant after film body elects woman headThe Malayalam film body elected Shwetha Menon as its first female president, marking a landmark moment in Malayalam cinema. However, veteran Kollam Thulasi's sexist remarks have overshadowed the celebration, reigniting debates on industry sexism.

Boney Kapoor shows off his age-old outfits, Janhvi has the sweetest reactionBoney Kapoor impressed fans on Instagram by posing in a stylish look featuring his 22-year-old jeans and 18-year-old shirt, paired with a fresh haircut. His daughter Janhvi Kapoor added a sweet "Wow papa" comment, while fans showered him with love and nostalgic messages.

Bads of Bollywood X reactions: Aryan Khan's glimpse gives fans full SRK deja vuAryan Khan's upcoming web series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' first teaser sparked widespread attention. The series, written and directed by Aryan Khan, features a star-studded cast and is backed by Gauri Khan, promising a stylised entertainment world.

Fahadh Faasil recalls losing film with Oscar-winning director Alejandro InarrituFahadh Faasil shared that he was once in talks for a film with Hollywood director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu but couldn't take it up because of accent issues. He added that he wants his most special projects to come from Malayalam cinema itself.

Why Salman Khan's Sikandar failed? AR Murugadoss admits missteps in executionSalman Khan's 'Sikandar', directed by AR Murugadoss, has underperformed at the box office despite high expectations. Murugadoss admitted the emotional story did not connect with audiences and expressed hope to return to Bollywood when he finds his comfort zone.

Dipika Kakar shares health update, says cancer treatment hits hard and heavyDipika Kakar, who underwent a major surgery for stage 2 liver cancer in June, recently shared a heartfelt health update with fans, admitting that treatment days often feel heavy.

Coolie box office Day 3: Rajinikanth film storms past Rs 250 crore worldwideRajinikanth's 'Coolie' continues its unstoppable run at the box office, raking in Rs 158.25 crore domestically in just three days. The film has become the highest-grossing Tamil release of 2025.

general news.headline: 'Forget Nato, Crimea': Is Trump throwing Zelenskyy under the bus for Russia deal?Surprisingly, Trump's remarks ahead of his meeting with Zelenskyy came even after his special envoy, Steve Witkoff, said that Moscow was willing to let the US and its European allies provide Nato-style security guarantees to Kyiv as part of a potential peace deal, describing the development as "game-changing."

Why US spares China, but hits India: Marco Rubio defends Russian oil hypocrisySpeaking to Fox News on August 17, Marco Rubio cautioned that targeting Chinese refiners would have disruptive consequences for the global oil market.

Jawan killed, 2 injured in IED planted by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's BijapurA jawan of the Chhattisgarh Police's District Reserve Guard and at least two other personnel were killed after an IED planted by Maoists in Bijapur district went off on Monday morning.

Asia Cup: Will India make another Jasprit Bumrah mistake?India's Asia Cup title defence can work out well even without Jasprit Bumrah. However, his presence will be needed for the important Tests and the T20 World Cup 2026. Given the fragility of his body, will it be ideal to make him play in the Asia Cup 2025?

Will Trump use this Pakistani tool as leverage against India?Pakistan has already started using the US State Department's 'foreign terror organisation' tag on the Balochistan Liberation Army and the Majeed Brigade against India. Will the Trump White House try to use the tag and Pakistan's claims as leverage against India?

Mumbai under red alert, heavy rain expected in next 3–4 hoursWith rains showing no respite in Mumbai, the India Meteorological Department issued an orange alert for the city on Monday and a red alert for several coastal districts in Maharashtra, including Raigad, Ratnagiri, Satara, Kolhapur, and Pune.

BJP picks Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan as NDA Veep candidateThe BJP has announced Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan as NDA's Vice Presidential candidate after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned last month citing health reasons.

3 schools, including DPS, and one college in Delhi's Dwarka get bomb threatAt least three schools, including the Delhi Public School, and another college in Dwarka received bomb threats via email on Monday morning.

Army jawan restrained, beaten by toll plaza workers in Meerut; 4 arrestedKapil, a soldier stationed in Jammu and Kashmir, was returning to duty from his village and traveling to Delhi with a friend. As they neared the toll plaza on the Karnal Highway, a dispute over the traffic jam and toll fee reportedly escalated into a physical assault.

Flood scare in Delhi as Yamuna breaches danger mark, advisory issuedThe warning mark for the city is 204.50 metres, while the danger mark is 205.33 metres. Evacuation of people starts at 206 metres. The Central Water Commission said all concerned agencies have been asked to take precautionary measures to handle a flood-like situation.

Volvo EX30 Review: Small Car, Big StatementThe Volvo EX30 isn't trying to be everything to everyone—it's a small, stylish EV that knows exactly where it stands. The trick will be in delivering just enough of everything you actually need and not charging you for the extra.

Woman breaks down, blames ChatGPT for ruining her holiday in viral TikTok videoIn a TikTok video that has now gone viral on social media, Mery Caldass broke down while explaining that she had relied on the AI chatbot to confirm if a visa was needed.

sports.headline: Ishan Kishan ruled out of Duleep Trophy, Odisha cricket announces replacementEast Zone captain Ishan Kishan has been ruled out of the Duleep Trophy 2025, with Aashirwad Swain being named as the replacement. In Kishan's absence, Abhimanyu Easwaran will be leading the team in the tournament.

Iga Swiatek downs Elena Rybakina, faces Jasmine Paolini in finalIga Swiatek delivered a relentless performance on Sunday, winning 10 of the last 13 games to defeat Elena Rybakina 7-5, 6-3, setting up a final showdown with Jasmine Paolini.

Ruben Amorim snaps back at reporter in Bayindir's defence after Arsenal lossRuben Amorim snapped back at a reporter, coming out swinging in defence of goalkeeper Altay Bayindir following Manchester United's 1-0 defeat to Arsenal, firmly rejecting questions over the Turkish international's place in the starting line-up.

Only way Ravindra Jadeja gets injured is through his sword celebration: Brett LeeBrett Lee lauds Ravindra Jadeja's fitness after his stellar England tour, joking that his sword celebration could risk a rotator cuff injury. Lee had also claimed that Jadeja still has two years left in his Test career.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
